fields.helperText: Refer to Connections 2050 project list for examples.

fields.name: county

fields.helperText: Select all counties relevant for project location. Percent allocation of relevant funds for each county selected will be split evenly.

fields.name: scope
fields.label: Project Scope
fields.placeholder: Briefly describe the improvements to be made to the listed facility if funds are allocated. This description should be kept short for inclusion in the Plan document(s).

fields.name: need
fields.label: Project Need
fields.placeholder: Describe the problem the project is intended to address. The need should be factual, quantifiable, establish evidence of current or future transportation problems, and justify commitment of funding this project and impacts to the environment.

fields.name: route_id
fields.label: Facility or Route Name and Number

fields.name: extent
fields.label: Project Boundaries
fields.helperText: Where does the project start and end? Please provide specific details such as the starting and terminating routes, intersections, road segments, or distances from known intersections. If the project corridor is known but specific elements like ADA access are not, please still provide the corridor information. Note: For a project to be modeled, evaluated, and considered for funding, it must be mappable. However, if no location is available, it can remain on the unfunded Vision Plan. Ex: along Highland Avenue between 4th St and 9th St;  I-95 and Columbus Boulevard between Chestnut and Walnut streets, extending from Front Street to the Delaware River.

fields.helperText: Select roadway project subcategories or transit categories that reflect the scope of the project (check all that apply). See full category descriptions (page 53, table C-1).

values: R4.03 - Transportation Systems Management and Operations (TSMO)
R5.03 - Additionally Funded Road Network Expansion

fields.name: cat_share
fields.label: Funding distribution among primary project categories
fields.helperText: Enter the approximate percentage of funds allocated to each primary category. Note: If a subcategory was selected in the previous question, the corresponding primary category must have >0%. Ensure the total allocation sums to 100%. Roadway projects are subject to validation by DOTs.

fields.name: project_cost
fields.label: List the total cost of the project in millions of dollars, (including all phases and any funds already allocated or spent).
fields.helperText:
Note the new MRP threshold of $40 million, except for R5 projects in the second two Plan Periods, which can be any cost.
Please note the new MRP threshold of $40 million, except for R5 Roadway System Expansion projects in the second and third Plan Periods, which can be of any cost.

R5.01
Large-scale projects that will have a significant impact on regional travel. These include addition of new through lanes by widening, extending, or building new limited access highways of any length; creating new interchanges between highways (Highway Performance Monitoring System [HPMS] functional classes 1 or 2) and arterials; widening, extending, or building new principal arterials (HPMS functional classes 3 or 4) for more than three lane miles; or adding additional capacity for flex lanes or part-time shoulder use to existing facilities.

R5.02
Network expansion projects that do not rise to the level of Major Regional Project but will have a significant impact on regional travel. These projects are generally less than three lane miles in length on minor arterial, collector, or local roads.

fields.name: base_year
fields.label: What year was the cost of this project estimated?

fields.name: external_funding
fields.label: List any funding source and amount (in millions of dollars) that is not federal, state, or local funding. Examples include private development, philanthropic, external authority.

fields.name: timeperiod
fields.label: Indicate the time period(s) for construction based on project readiness (select all that apply). Fiscal constraint discussions may change final programming.

fields.name: traffic_impact
fields.label: Will your project impact existing traffic movements by involving any of these activities? (Select all that apply)?
options: Creating a new roadway or combining road lanes
Removing an existing vehicular travel lane
Adding new traffic movement(s) at an interchange
Creating a new fixed route transit service
Increasing/adding parking at a transit station
Significant changes to transit service levels
Adding a traffic signal at an unsignalized location

fields.name: traffic_impact_note
fields.label: Provide additional details for the expected traffic impacts
fields.placeholder: For example, if a lane is being added or removed, specify how many. For a roadway extension, indicate which road, the distance, and the extent of the extension in lane miles where applicable. Be specific about the number of additional parking spaces, or fixed transit stations added. Detail transit service level changes.

fields.name: signalize_location
fields.label: Identify the location where new traffic signal(s) will be added.
fields.placeholder: Ex: Intersections of State St and Carroll St, Perry St and Allen Pl., Southard and Perry St

condition.value: Adding a traffic signal at an unsignalized location

fields.name: safety_strategies
fields.label: Have any substantive safety strategies been identified for this project as part of design phase?
fields.helperText: If yes, documentation is required in project engineering. See FHWA's Safety Countermeasure here.

fields.name: green_design

fields.helperText: Documentation required in project engineering for any selected elements.
options: Vegetated medians/curb bump outs (more than just grass)
Other non-Green Stormwater Infrastructure solutions to address a documented flooding issue

fields.name: community_engagement
fields.label: Has there been any community engagement related to this project that has been documented? Is there project-related community engagement planned?

fields.name: route_alignment
fields.label: What is the proposed alignment of the new transit route?
fields.placeholder: Specify the preferred transit route alignment from the starting point to the endpoint. Include the name and number of the preferred alternative. If available, please upload the GIS layer.

fields.name: station_locations
fields.label: How many stations will be built along this new route? Where will they be located? What are costs for using different fare zones?
fields.placeholder: Specific locations of new stations along new route alignment, including the fare zone each station is located in. Please upload geospatial data with attachments if available.

fields.name: att_desc
fields.text:
Additional project documentation provided as attachments is required for project evaluation. Based on the project details provided in this application the following documentation items should attached using the file attachment dialog below.

Geospatial (GIS) Location: Include shapefiles, drawings, or sketches to assist with mapping the project for conformity analysis and project evaluation. Note: a project must be mappable in order to be modeled, evaluated, and receive funding, but can remain on the unfunded Vision Plan if no location is available.

fields.name: t3_requirement
fields.text: Transit Expansion/Improvements: Please include relevant geospatial data for proposed alignment and station locations. Time table accounting for travel time between stations and dwell time at each station in seconds or mark no change if project is on an existing line with expected travel time changes (GTFS if available). Additional documentation on station parking and headways.

fields.name: ss_requirement
fields.text: Substantive Safety Countermeasures: provide engineering and design documentation.

fields.name: gd_requirement
fields.text: Green Design Elements: provide engineering and design documentation.

fields.name: ce_requirement
fields.text: Community Engagement: documentation of previous or planned engagement is required if a project has more potential burdens than benefits to EJ populations. See Project Evaluation Criteria for additional information.
